topic: Deep dive: _random standard library module in Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: Deep dive: _random standard library module in Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Deep Dive: The random Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides an in-depth exploration of the random standard library module in Python 3.12+, explaining its key features and functionalities.
key_points: The random module offers a wide range of functions for generating random numbers and sequences with various distributions.
Python 3.12+ introduces improvements and enhancements to the existing functionality of the random module.
The module is essential for tasks such as simulations, cryptography, and machine learning.

code_examples.code:
import random
prints([random.gauss(10, 2) for _ in range(10)])

version_notes: Python 3.12+: Improved performance and new functions have been added to the random module.
Previous versions: The basic functionalities remain the same, but performance may vary.
caveats: While the random module generates pseudo-random numbers, it is not cryptographically secure for sensitive applications. Use other modules like secrets or cryptography for such purposes.
When using floating-point numbers, be aware that precision may vary depending on the specific distribution function used.
